summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from February 2023 discussing a civil lawsuit filed by the Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands (USVI) against JP Morgan Chase. The lawsuit alleges the bank failed to comply with banking regulations and report suspicious activity related to Jeffrey Epstein's criminal acts in the USVI. The emails show FBI personnel in New York and San Juan trying to determine if they have relevant information or jurisdiction.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of civil lawsuit and underlying criminal investigation
persons.context: The civil lawsuit against JP Morgan Chase is related to his criminal acts, specifically for violations of trafficking laws in the US Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Jed S. Rakoff
persons.context: Signed the order consolidating the USVI's lawsuit against JP Morgan Chase with two other related cases (Doe v. Deutsche Bank and Doe v. JP Morgan Chase & Co.).

events.title: Court Order Consolidating USVI v. JP Morgan Chase
events.description: Judge Jed S. Rakoff orders the consolidation of the Government of the USVI's civil lawsuit against JP Morgan Chase with two other related cases (Doe v. Deutsche Bank and Doe v. JP Morgan Chase & Co.) for all pretrial purposes.

events.title: USVI Amended Complaint Filed
events.description: The Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands files an amended complaint in its civil lawsuit against JP Morgan Chase, which is then consolidated with other cases.

events.title: FBI Internal Email Chain Regarding USVI Lawsuit
events.description: Multiple FBI agents and personnel in New York and San Juan exchange emails to determine if they have any information or involvement related to the USVI's civil lawsuit against JP Morgan Chase concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: St. Thomas, V.I. (Ron de Lugo Federal Building, 5500 Veterans Drive)
keyFacts: The Government of the U.S. Virgin Islands filed a civil lawsuit against JP Morgan Chase for violations related to Jeffrey Epstein, including the Trafficking Victims Protection Act and Virgin Islands anti-corruption laws.
The lawsuit alleges JP Morgan Chase failed to follow Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) regulations, thereby not alerting authorities to criminal acts occurring in the USVI jurisdiction.
The case was consolidated by Judge Jed S. Rakoff with two other related cases: 'Doe v. Deutsche Bank' (22-cv-10018) and 'Doe v. JP Morgan Chase & Co.' (22-cv-10019).

Internal FBI emails show agents from the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking and White Collar Crimes desks attempting to determine their potential role or information related to this civil financial case.
The document highlights the post-conviction legal and financial repercussions for institutions that allegedly enabled Epstein's activities.
